passage: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
moral: God made everything. We can thank Him.
reflectionQ: What part of God‚Äôs world do you love?

passage: This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
moral: Today is God‚Äôs gift. Be glad.
reflectionQ: What made you smile today?
challenge: Tell someone, ‚ÄúGod made today!‚Äù

passage: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
reflectionQ: When did you feel God close to you?

passage: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
reflectionQ: How can you be kind to a friend today?

passage: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.
reflectionQ: What is one thing you can do right away?
challenge: Do a small chore the first time you‚Äôre asked.

passage: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

passage: We love him, because he first loved us.
moral: God loved us first, so we love others.
reflectionQ: Who can you show love to today?
challenge: Give one kind word or hug.

passage: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
reflectionQ: What gentle words can you say?

passage: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
moral: Jesus helps you do hard things.
reflectionQ: What hard thing will you try today?
challenge: Try again once before asking for help.

passage: Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
reflectionQ: How will you obey today?
challenge: Listen the first time at bedtime or cleanup.

passage: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good.
moral: God‚Äôs world is good. Thank Him for it.
reflectionQ: What good thing did God make that you saw today?

passage: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made:

challenge: Say, ‚ÄúGod made me special!‚Äù to yourself.

passage: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
moral: God is good forever. Say thank you.
reflectionQ: What can you thank God for right now?
challenge: Tell a grown-up one thing you‚Äôre thankful for.

passage: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

challenge: Say, ‚ÄúGod, I trust You,‚Äù before bed.

passage: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
moral: Talk to God, and He will show you the way.
reflectionQ: How can you remember God before you start something?

passage: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
reflectionQ: What kind thing can you do today?

passage: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

passage: Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
reflectionQ: When is it hard to tell the truth?
challenge: Tell the truth today, even about small things.

passage: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
reflectionQ: When do you feel safe with God?
challenge: Say, ‚ÄúJesus, help me,‚Äù when you feel scared.

passage: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
reflectionQ: What do you see in the sky today?
challenge: Look up and thank God for the sky.

passage: O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
reflectionQ: What good thing has God done for you?
challenge: Tell someone, ‚ÄúGod is good to me.‚Äù

passage: Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
moral: Enjoy God, and He cares for your heart.
reflectionQ: How can you enjoy God today?

passage: Serve the LORD with gladness: come before his presence with singing.

passage: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
reflectionQ: When can you read or hear God‚Äôs Word today?
challenge: Learn one short verse this week.

passage: Fear thou not; for I am with thee:

reflectionQ: What makes you brave with God?
challenge: Say, ‚ÄúGod is with me,‚Äù when you feel shy or scared.

passage: Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.

challenge: Take a deep breath and say, ‚ÄúThank you, God,‚Äù three times.

passage: ‚Ä¶to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God.
moral: Do right, love kindness, walk humbly.
reflectionQ: How can you be kind today?
challenge: Share or help someone once today.

passage: Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

passage: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
reflectionQ: What does putting God first look like for you?

passage: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them:

passage: Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.
reflectionQ: How can you come to Jesus today?

passage: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength:
reflectionQ: How can you show love to God today?
challenge: Say, ‚ÄúI love You, God,‚Äù and sing one line of praise.

passage: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

passage: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

passage: I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.

challenge: Turn on a light and say, ‚ÄúJesus is my light.‚Äù

passage: A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you,

passage: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life:

passage: It is more blessed to give than to receive.

passage: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

challenge: Tell God ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù for one wrong thing today.

passage: But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.

challenge: Say, ‚ÄúThank You, Jesus, for loving me.‚Äù

passage: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

passage: Charity suffereth long, and is kind;

passage: Let all your things be done with charity.

passage: And be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.

passage: Be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.

passage: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

passage: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.

passage: Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.

passage: Pray without ceasing.

passage: In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.

passage: I am with thee, and will keep thee whithersoever thou goest‚Ä¶
reflectionQ: Where did you go today that God kept you safe?

passage: The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.

passage: Honour thy father and thy mother‚Ä¶

passage: The LORD bless thee, and keep thee:

passage: Thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart‚Ä¶
moral: Love God with your whole heart.

passage: Be strong and of a good courage‚Ä¶ he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.

passage: ‚Ä¶as for me and my house, we will serve the LORD.

passage: ‚Ä¶man looketh on the outward appearance, but the LORD looketh on the heart.

passage: As for God, his way is perfect‚Ä¶ he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.

passage: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.

passage: ‚Ä¶for the joy of the LORD is your strength.

passage: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep‚Ä¶

passage: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear?

passage: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

passage: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

passage: The LORD is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble‚Ä¶

passage: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find‚Ä¶
